text: Pours hazy dark brown to black with a lasting, foamy, dark beige head that leaves some lacing. Smells like roasted malt and hops. The aroma contains coffee, licorice, hops, roasted malt, wood, figs and raisin. It tastes medium caramel-like sweet at first, then medium hoppy bitter. The finish is roasted and light alcoholic, though the ABV remains well hidden. Medium body, oily/syrupy texture, soft carbonation. To me, this has a lot of qualities of an (Imperial) Stout, but that is another discussion. Basically, its a complex and well-balanced beer. Glorious!
Mooi quad heel erg in de chocolade een geroosterde toneen zelfs een beetje drop

Bottle from bierhandel. Dark brown black. Thin brown head. Thin body. Medium high sweetness, medium bitterness. Some low acidity. Aroma and flavour is spices, fruity, chili, vanilla, wood, toffee, prunes.
Bottle sample at a tasting at Maxs place. Thanks Max. Dark brown. Caramel, dark fruits, licorice, a bit of chocolate, brown sugar, alcohol, sweet, a bit sticky.
LCI. Uit de fles geschonken. Verrassend lekkere geur, rood fruit. Smaak is ook verrassend lekker: mout, caramel, rood fruit, boozy. Zoet met licht fruitig zuurtje. Prima
Pours brown to black with a beige head, aroma of dark fruits, sugar and alcohol, flavor of alcohol, dark fruits, medium bodied

Multiple versions on Zythos festivals. Hazy dark brown color with small head. Aroma has belgian candy, coffee, brown sugar, molasses, and lots of aromatic espresso ground for the Coffe & Cocoa version. Taste reflects the aroma quite well, for both versions. That means a lot of espresso in the coffee & cocoa version. Carbonation is medium.
Very full bodied, complex, estery aromas. Thick mouthfeel, solid aromas, more esters, dried fruits, some warming alcohol. Great.
Zwart bier met weinig schuim. Smaak is krachtig warm, zoet en kruidig met iets van anijs, drop en kersen.

Bottle, 10.3%. Sweetish and caramelly aroma, some brown sugar, perhaps with a touch of toffee. Clear dark brown colour with a deep red shine. Big stable brown head. The flavour is sweet but not too sugary. Vinous and citric with a rather boozy note. I should have kept it in the cellar for a year or two, but that is too late now, I guess :-)

Bottle. Pours hazy coffee brown with airy,mrocky but stable tan head. Clear aroma of caramel,mmalt,mfruit and raisins,mwith notes of alcohol and hops. Sweet flavour of caramel malt, raisins and Belgian yeast, with notes of fruit and hops touches of spices. Bitterish, boozy aftertaste with estery notes and mild acidic hints. Warming alcohol presence. Decent.
On tap at BBF. Dark brown colour with tan head. raisins and caramel aroma. Sweet, caramel, raisins, malt and chocolate taste. Medium body.
Roasted malts and coffee aromas. Dark colour and taste like stout. Nice lacing. Slight bitterness.

UPDATED: MAR 23, 2017 Bottle at home, exp 07/08/17. Very dark brown, foamy beige head. Nice roasted malty espresso and dark chocolate notes dominate, some red and dried fruits, vanilla, light leather and smoke, lightly bitter in the finish, boozy at the end. Well balanced altogether, lacks a nicely lingering aftertaste. Good body, a little too lively carbonated.

Bottle @ home. Pours a brown liquid with a medium beige head. Aroma of dried fruits, spices, herbs, milk chocolate, anise, grass, caramel and sweet dark syrup, vanilla. Medium to big body. Palate is smooth with medium to high carbonation. Flavors of caramel, herbs, pears, grass, vanilla, dark syrup, chocolate. Dry finish and balanced spicy bitterness.
Bottle at home. Bought at Wijnhuis Panningen. Roasty, chocolate, fruity. Tasty quad!

Bottle. Pours a dark amber brown color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty spicy dark fruit caramel aroma. Sweetish malty spicy caramel and dark fruit flavor. Has a sweetish malty caramel and dark fruit finish.
Bottle. Black. Malt, a hint of licorice and figs in the aroma. Malty sweet soft roasty flavorwith caramel, dried fruit and a hint of licorice. Soft spicy notes. Mint. Slightly disappointing.
Gran cerveza cuadruple con un sabor a chocolate superintenso. La espuma dura muchísimo. Repetiria sin dudar

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Rami Rami is drinking an Inglorious Quad by Inglorious Brew Stars at PowiśleKandyzowane owoce, karmel, przyprawowosc, nieco kawy czy czeko, ciemnych owocow, slodki, alko najs schowane, srednio ciala, lepkawy, bdbRami Rami: Jakies dziwne takie cocacolowo-orzechowe posmakiRami Rami: Jeszcze jakies kwaskowate rzeczy wylaza na cieplo, ciut w dol te gwiazdkiOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

Zeer mooie vanilleneus met gebrande tonen. De smaak heeft een mooie ronding, meer gebrand gerst, uitermate uitgebalanceerd. De afdronk valt te snel stil om een topper te zijn. De whiskey barrel aged versie voegt net dat extra ding toe.

Bottle from the Beergium Web Shop. Black pour with a beige head. Aromas of dates, treacle toffee, chocolate, dark fruit. Flavours of currants, warm spice, bonfire toffee, caramel. Warming, soothing alcohol burn. Sweet, vinous finish. Tasty stuff.
Flaska från Belgoklubben. Mörkbrun med ljusbrunt skum. Doft av choklad och lite humle. Lätt i smaken med viss sötma.

Bottle. Black in colour, small head. Quite roasty, nice chocolate, dried fruits, licorice, light alcohol. Medium sweet, malty, medium body - could be more thick, soft carbonation, finish is lightly bitter. Nicely balanced quad.
Sample at Örebro Öl & Whisky 2016. Fruity and malty smell. Similar taste. Sweet taste. Well rounded and well made.

Piana sycząca, beżowa, średnio trwałą. Barwa ciemno mahoniowa, nieprzejrzysta. Aromat ciekawy, dość intensywny, jest sporo ciemnych słodów w postaci czekolady, palonego ziarna, karmelu, lukrecji, są suszone owoce (rodzynki, daktyle), jest porto, melasa i wanilia... Super. W smaku dokładnie to samo, słodko, nutki stoutowo-palone, zachaczające nawet o tytoniowość mieszają się z estrami i fenolami charakterystycznymi dla mocnych piw od trapistów. W posmaku lekko pikantne przyprawy, zioła i mineralność, może nawet odrobina soli morskiej... Goryczka nieduża, wysycenie średnie, nieźle wkomponowany alkohol. W odbiorze pełne, lekko szorstkie, popiołowe, niegęste...

Quad z serii tych bardziej palonych, bliskich Belgian RISom, słodkich, wyrazistych, co bardzo mi odpowiada. Przydałaby się nieco bardziej oleista faktura.

Pikzwart bier met een schuimkraag die snel verdwijnt. Erg rijk aroma, waar onder andere iets fruitigs en vooral iets geroosterd in zit. Komt ook terug in de smaak, maar wel een stuk minder. Vooral een gebrande smaak, maar dat fruitige blijft ook wel even hangen.

33cl-fles van bij Bierhalle Deconinck te Vichte. U: Bijna zwart met een bruine schuimkraag. G: Chocolade, drop, kandijsuiker en wat alcohol. S: Zoet met een lichte moutbitterheid in de afdronk. Chocolade, kandij, donker fruit en licht kruidig. Alcoholwarmte. Lekker! M: Volmondig, licht sticky en een lichte carbonatie.

Flaska på Örebro Öl & Whisky Festival. Bra balans mellan söta och välrostade toner. Mycket torkad frukt, russin, brunt socker, nästan lite madeiratoner. Sötman hålls tillbaka av lite bittra toner. Lite beska och värmande alkohol i avslutningen. "Hops your brain" vet jag dock inte riktigt om den gör. Är ju snarare en maltbomb, om något?

0.75l bottle. Black body with an enormous light brown head. Aroma of chocolate, figs, dates, licorice, raisins and caramel. Taste of chocolate, caramel, licorice, raisins and plums. Very complex yet balanced brew. The alcohol can be felt, but not disturbing. Awesome beer.

75 cl, Belgoklubben. Dark color, almost like a porter. Aroma is beautifully complex, red berries, dried fruit, raspberry, liquorice, coffee, chocolate, roasted malt, yeasty peppery notes. Simply ace (in room temperature). Taste is basically the same, roasted malty notes, raspberries, dried fruit, vanilla, liquorice, low bitterness, dryness in the finish, warm alcohol. Medium body (perhaps a bit more body could do even more wonder to the taste), medium carbo. Very good.

Bottle 33cl. poured into a small chalice. Pitch black, small creamy tan head, half-way lasting, good lacing; cocoa nose, aroma roasted malts, chocolate, light dark fruits, some licorice; taste medium heavy sweet and light bitter, roasted malts, chocolate, dark fruits, some toffee, alcohol; sweetbitter aftertaste, spicy notes, warming alcohol; full-bodied, creamy texture, average carbonation; heavy duty but well-balanced and round, very nice Quadruple.

Meglepő feketeséggel gurul a pohárba, habja is szinte már imperial stoutokat idéző jellegű, fajsúlyos ital benyomását kelti tehát erőteljes külleme. Illatai sejtelmesek, élesek, mentás fekete kávés nem létező kompozícióját idézőek, medvecukros, pörkölt magvas hangulatúak, barna süteménytésztás aromájúak. Csípőskés, élénk kortyai idővel szépen lecsitulnak, mint ahogyan az a belga főzetek esetében gyakorta előfordul, teltebbé, kerekebbé válnak, mákos-diós, kissé még vaníliásnak is ható malátás jegyeket hordoznak, padláson szárított, kissé poros aszalt szilvás vonalakat rajzolnak, az aromái között már megismert gyógynövényes, szénás, medvecukros hangulatot árasztanak, melengető alkoholos köntöst öltenek. Mint ahogyan a műfaj, ez a quadrupel sem egyszerű, nekem mégis bejön, s a pontjai alapján vélhetően másoknak is.

Flaska från Sameur-bier. En ovanligt mörk quad någon stans mellan en imperial porter och en quadrupel. Komplex doft med mörka bär, mörk torkad frukt, lakrits, kaffe, choklad, rostad malt, rök och molass. Söt, komplex och välbalanserad smak som doften. Riktigt gott.
Zwart bier met kleine donkerbruine schuimkraag. Aroma van gebrande mouten, koffie, hop, peer, bessen. Zoet, met een prettige bitterheid. Droge en lange nasmaak. Sprankelend co2, prettig palet.

33cl bottle. Dark brown/black with thin tan head. Roasted malts, dark chocolate, caramel, raisins and berries in the aroma. Average carbonation and full bodied. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter with roasted and fruity notes. Long dry finish. Overall, a very good beer.

This pours with a giant warm brown head and marvellous dark brown colour. The nose is full of dried fruit and dark ripe berries. Taste goes along with the nose and caramel notes accompanies it well. Palate is also sweet with almost tobacco on the back of the tounge. Enjoyable really.

The taste and aromas are not overwhelming like other quadruples, but its good. Theres a combination of heavier aromas (chocolate, roasted malts, a bit of wood?) and sweeter aromas (red fruit). A good combination and well balanced. Although this normally isnt my cup of tea, I really enjoyed this beer.
Definitely on to a great beer. Needs better hopping to give it the body and aroma it deserves.

33cl bottle. Dark brown with huge head. Aroma is dark fruits, raisins, chocolate, alcohol. Lots of carbonation and medium thick mouth feel. Start off with sweet dried fruits, bit of coke like herbal and caramels but well backed by deep chocolate. Gets dry and bitter in the end. Long finish. Nice.

Bottle. A dark brown to black beer wtih a dense, two-finger light tan head. Curtains. The aroma has lots of licorice and roasted malts, even charcoal, for a quad, with some dried fruits and alcohol in the back. Caramel sauce too. Its full bodied and rather heavy on the carbonation, lightly warming, and quite sweet on the palate. Licorice, caramel sauce, roasted malts and some burnt down bonfire in the flavor. In the far back it resembles a regular quad, especially in the lasting swallow. Sure, its a fine brew, but in my opinion the carbonation is so high it messes with the joy of drinking it. 160810

extremely bitter taste that sticks to the tongue
unpleasant burnt flavors of coffee and chocolate
Nearly black, clear with lasting beige head. Aroma has malt and brown sugar. Whiffs of alcohol. Flavour has licorice, chocolate and brown sugar. Smooth with nice alcohol warmth.

Bottle from Beergium. Pitch black with brownbeige head.
Caramel, bread, chocolate, raisins, dark fruit, coffee.
Pretty bitter, medium sweet. Got a roastiness and herbal charachter going on.
Medium body with creamy texture. Lively carbonation. 
A bit to fizzy and herbal for my taste.

Roasted toffee chocolate. Dry medium mouthfeel. Excellent. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
chocolate, coffee, roasty, dough,alcohol, soy sauce, smoke, black, tan foam, rocky head, heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter,

Das Imperial Stout unter den Quadrupels. Kräftig. Wild & Mild. Widerspenstig & Rund. Das alles kann es und kommt daher sicher ins Ziel. Ein Genuss. Röst, Malz, Süsse, IBUs und intensiver Nachhall halten sich die Waage. Klasse. ZYTHOS BEER FESTIVAL 2016 in Leuven. 0,1/1Jetson.
Bottle at BGBB3 bottle share, sample. Dark fruits, caramel, espresso, pretty boozy, somewhat thin. Nice, but didnt realy get me.

Many thanks for this beer to JefVerstraete. Piwo o ladnej ciemno bezowej i trwalej piance. Czarne nie przezroczysta barwa, w smaku likierowe, rozgrzewające, szlachetny alkohol. Choc nieco jest przy mocny bo przyglusza pewne wrazenia początkowe chmielu, który trochę się da nawet wyczuć w zapachu i lekko w smaku ale zaraz po przelknieciu znika. Dobry Quad ale o zbyt dominującym alkoholu. Szkoda ze nie udało się do końca go ukryc.

Nice bottle, drinktemperature is also on the label, batch or best-before unknown, cloudy deep black beer with a very nice stable capuccino head, chocolate, coffee, no hoppy, finish long, medium body, creamy,

Drunk from 33cl bottle bought from Delhaize. Dark strong beer.

 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Drank with Thijs and Bram 29-04-16 at the tasting at the Vinotake in Waalwijk. Good beer. Roasty and malt are dominant. Also some sweetness, but not much. Okay beer.
Coffee and cocoa version: Black. Strong aroma of espresso. Flavour of coffee grinds and chocolate ice cream - 9_4_9_4_18=4.4

UPDATED: APR 26, 2016 Almost black. Lots of coffee, some roast, brown sugar. Great full bitter and malty aroma. (On tap at Zythos 2016)

Cocoa And Coffee Bean version rating: (3.9) Black. Loads of coffee. The normal version is lots of coffee, this is huge. A touch sharper, but very tasty. It really looses touch with the original. Great coffee aroma though. (On tap at Zythos 2016)
UPDATED: MAR 21, 2017 Dark brown with a lasting off-white head. Roasted aroma with a yeasty touch. Sweet, very sweet, roasted flavour with notable alcohol.

Bottle from Willems. Pours black with a creamy beige head. Overall its roasted and sweet with tobacco and chocolate notes. Ripe fruity. Sweet roasted flavor with fruity and pouch tobacco notes. Reminds me of a very well made Baltic Porter.

erg donker bruin (zwart) met volle schuimige bruine kraag. aroma van donker fruit (rozijn, pruim), bruine suiker, alcohol, Belgische gist, mout/graan, lichte hop. smaken zijn behoorlijk alcoholisch, rozijn, pruim, dadels, zwaar zoet, chocolade, (redelijk), graan, mond vullende co2, enorm stevig bier, veel te veel co2, caramel.
Bottle. Deep brown color with a medium sized foamy beige head. Aroma of caramel and malt. Sweet and medium bitter taste with some sourness.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Bottle from Beergium. Almost black with a light brown head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel, roasted malt, dried fruit, yeasty and alcohol. Flavor is very sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish with a little warming alcohol. 050316

Bottle, february 20th 2015. Black body with a medium brown head. Aroma is nutty with roasted malt and licorice. Light sweetness with a herbal taste, caramel, pleasant bitterness with chocolate and dark fruit in finish. A lovely beer (and the brewery name isnt bad either).
Quadrupel belga perfetta. Colore splendido rubino carico, robusta e forte. Da meditazione.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Liked bottle, liked beer. Well balanced dark sided Belgian quad with some nice herbal aspect, figgy dried fruited, some yeast presence, vanilla, some toast, caramel, light licorice. Mostly sweet with light bitterness Feels creamy.
Solid all the way

bottle bb 07/8/17 dark medium head malty fruity roadty alcool dry
Scura schiuma media media persistenza fruttata maltata tostature caffe corretto secca discreto amaro quasi affumicata

Tap at t Antwaerps Bierhuyske, Antwerp. Poured an opaque dark brown, almost black colour with a frothy light tan head. The aroma is creamy caramel, roasty malt, dry dusty yeast. The flavour is moderate sweet with a fruity, light woody hop bitter, light liqourice alcohol palate. Medium bodied with average carbonation and a bubbly mouthfeel.

Bottle, [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Pours deep opaque black with a small, creamy beige head. Aroma has sweet malts, lots of cocoa, chocolate, light licorice, vinious. Medium carbonation, fine dry and quite creamy mouthfeel. Flavour has sweet malts, licorice, chocolate, lots of cocoa, a hint of coffee. Lovely bitter and a hint of smoke. Light grapefruit bitterness. Generally lovely.

Bottiglia ricevuta in dono. Aroma e gusto di malti torrefatti, cacao e vaniglia. Carbonazione quasi assente e alcol poco percettibile. Molto buona, al pari delle quad più famose. Introvabile in Italia.

Bottle from Willems, Grobbendonk. Pours nearly black with a beige head. Roast, Dark fruit, licorice, vanilla and syrup. Sweet , full bodied and very sippable with only a hint of warmth from alcohol. Delicious all the Way through!

Versa nel bicchiere di colore marrone scuro, tendente al nero; la schiuma è abbondante, cremosa, beige, dalla buona allacciatura e dallottima persistenza. Un aroma di frutta scura si mescola con zucchero candito, caffè, cioccolato e un accenno di liquirizia che solletica i sensi. In bocca inizia dolce con un corpo sodo ed un amaro di malti tostati. Il sapore iniziale è di melassa, zucchero di canna e frutti scuri, tra cui prugna ed un pizzico di uva passa. Al palato si crea un accento piccante, con chiodi di garofano, pepe, anice e liquirizia nera. Nel finale compare una ricca speziatura alcolica, che regala un pò di calore.

Als een liefhebber van donkere, stout-achtige bieren, met een rijk gebrande mout en candijsmaak, is dit een absoluut topbier voor mij. Niet één voor op vaste basis, maar voor af en toe een welkome verrassing. Zeer geschikt na een goede maaltijd of in de winter bij de stoof.
Zwarte kleur. Geur: kandij, moutig, rozijntjes. Smaak: zoet, kandij, weinig body.

dark brown colour, moderate sized beige creamy head; aroma of dried figs and sweet cherry, liqueur notes, toffee notes, mild coffee and some roastedness; taste of dried fruits like figs and cherry, chocolate and coffee notes, some caramel and minimal sourness; like aa great quadrupel with some stout notes

UPDATED: OCT 17, 2015 Zwart bier. Mokkakleurige schuimkraag. Mooi romig in de mond. Licht rokerig. Smaken van gebrande koffiebonen, chocolade, mout, klein beetje vanille. Eindigt met bittertje van de hop. Klasse.

Bottle 330ml. @ [ pre PBF X Vaasa Edition] by oh6gdx, Vaasa, Finland. [ As Inglorious Quad ].Clear dark black brown color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white to beige head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, sweet malt, moderate chocolatem light to moderate roasted, moderate to heavy yeasty, sweet yeast, fruity, figs, fudge. Flavor is moderate to light heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration, alcohol, sweet yeast, minerals, bubble gum, figs. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft, finish feel is light alcoholic. [20150723]
Samples at Billies Bier Cafeteria in Antwerp. Black with a huge creamy head. Light roast, vanilla, boozy, but with great balance. Light treacle/molasses aroma. Really good tasty beer.
Bottle at billies beer cafe. Pours black, nose is caramel, fruity, varnish, taste is similar, quite sweet, light chocolate, dry finish.

75cl bottle. A very dark quad. Aroma is metallic and minimal Strangely the bottle label refers to this as "complex". Flavour is vegetal; spinach. For a 10% er the mouth feel is thin. In style, it is an overpumped dubbel. The label says " hop your brain".No hops are in evidence but the label designer has certainly been inspired by some American beer labels they have seen. Astonishingly disappointing and finally a sink pour. It won some kind of award; pay to enter?
The beer has a deep brown color, with a beige head. Nice mixture of dark fruit accents and roasted malts. Slight hint of black pepper in the taste. Despite the high abv, it is very smooth to drink.

Bottled. Black colour, mediumsized brown head. Aroma is liquorice, some wood, mild herbal, floral and spicy notes with some alcohol as well. Flavour is liquorice, toffee, roast, alcohol, some wood and mild spicy notes. Wellbalanced, thick and bold.

Bottled at pre-PBF, Vasa edition.  Near black, rich firm head. Coffee, figs and madeira up front. Mid sweet with full body and rounded mouthfeel. Peppery with licorice and fudge. Figs and red wine. Warming and mellow. Nice.

Bottle (from beergium.com). Pours dark brown with light brown head. The small head stays for some moments. Aroma is sweet, sugar, roast, alcohol. Flavor is sweet, malt, caramel, dark fruits, dark chocolate, and some alcohol. Overall: good one.
Almost black with small light brown head. Stout style aroma with roasted coffee notes. Stout style taste: roasted malt, codes, chocolate. Remarkable sweet vanilla touch.
On tap at Namur beer fest. Dark, with nice brown cap. Bitter hippy taste and aroma, with some elements if coffee like.

Bottle sample, poured a murky black colour with a tanned head. Notes of sweet chocolate, roasted malts, citrus, raisins, sweet vanilla, and dark espresso notes, looks more like a imperial porter. Really nice

deep black colour with nice brown head, thick and frothy, lasts for 10 mins. aroma smells of caramel, coffee, roasty, spicy herbs, woody (sandalwood), clove, taste is medium heavy in spite of the alcohol, nice balance of sweet arrival, salty development and bitter finish. also some spicy notes: coriander, clove, liquorice. aftertaste a lttle metallic, sticky but overall not unpleasant. very nice ad rich beer to enjoy at a slow tempo

330ml bottle @martjooboluts, thanks. Pitch black color. Small size, tan head, stays. Roast, alcohol, chocolate, plums in aroma. Woody, roast, burnt grains, burning alcohol in taste. Ashy roast and booze in aftertaste. Got tons of booze and roast in it, but still feels bit watery. Too boozy for me.

330ml bottle - thanks martjoobolut!
Messy dishwatery and dark roast aroma. Improves as it warms, becomes sweeter and fuller, less watery, some chocolate. Full palate, some sugar, pleasant roast, but maybe a bit dry and ashy in places. Just a bit of alcohol warmth on swallowing, but that builds up over time. Trying too hard, methinks, and gone beyond the brewers limits.

Black beer, beige head, spotty lacing. Nose is soy sauce, licorice, malt, roasty notes, milk chocolate in the background. Flavor is fruity notes with salty soy sauce, chocolate and roast, finishes with roasty notes and alcohol burn. Oily and soft mouthfeel.

Bottle a dark brown black colored beer with a beige head aroma malts caramel spicy dried fruits spicy and hops flavor malts spicy fruits dried fruits some yeast some alcohol liqueur caramel and some hops

33cl bottle shared by Arve_Christian - thanks a lot! Pours dark brown with a beige head. Malty aroma with roasty notes, lots of sweet chocolate, some caramel and just hints of herbs and hops. Fairly sweet, a bit to much and not as balanced as expected. Certainly tasty, but not a favourite

On bottle from Drankenzentrale du Hopduvel, Gent. Pitch black color, good foam. Medium/ high aroma intensity; mocca, chocolate, roasted, hops, leather, dried fruits and some red berries. Full body & high complexity. Immediate sweetness, some sourness- balances ok- but is clearly on the sweet side. Very enjoyable 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle, 33cl, Geers. Pours dark, almost black. Nose of oyster sauce, licorice and burnt malts. Some iron / blood. Munich malt & biscuit aroma. Tastes very very similar to my own quad.

25/04/2015 @ ZBF shared with tderoeck, 77ships, PriorL and kraddel.
Dark brown, tanned head. Coffee, chocolate, caramel, spices
Intensiv süß malziger Antrunk, Kaffee. Die Süße ist zu stark, wenig Schokolade. Noch halbwegs rund. 12/9/8/9//9

33 cl bottle. Pours hazy brown with a dmall tan head. Aroma is roasted malty and light spiced. Sweet, toasted malty and caramelish. Toasted malty. Overripe fruity, light spiced. Dry and slight herbal. Bitter and dry finish.
Bottle at hbf15. Black color, tanned head. Aroma is sweet, rye bread, chocolate. Balanced taste, chocolate, rye bread.
Heel donkere kleur, lichtbruinige kraag, ruikt naar gebrande mout, licht peperig. Smaakt idem, beetje vlak op den duur, redelijk zoet. Nasmaak is een beetje plantig.

Found back quite some tasting notes, among them, this one.
APPEARANCE: pitch black beer, small unstable beige head.
NOSE: chocolate, little smoked, vanilla, some coffee, some liquorice.
TASTE: liquorice, very sweet, coffee, chocolate, little smoked, could be more for its ABV though.

Taste @ home from bottle 33 cl Bierhalle Deconinck.
Black color, with a big beige head. 
Aroma: raisin, roasted malts, chocolate, bit spices. Full body. 
Taste: sweet, raisin, soft alcohol warm feeling, hopsbitter notes. Sweetness in finish. 
Good beer
Donkerbruin, pikzwart, sterk schuim. Complexe schmaak. Vrij stroperig, beetje Westvleteren. Voor herhaling vatbaar!!

UPDATED: APR 25, 2015 at the beer festival de mus along with Yves black colored body with an off white head and a roasted malt hops aroma a roasted malt hops fruity bitter sweet chocolate taste with a alcholic bitter finish

Shared with Wim at bierfestival buurtwerken molen oost. Black colored beer with large diminishing brown head and no carbonation visible. Malty coffee aroma. Full sparkling palate. Finish is hopped roasted coffee bitter spicy finish.

0.33 bottle. Black color and a medium, thick, black head. Aroma of dark malts, licorice, and dark fruits. Taste is heavy on the malty side with toast, dark fruits, some alcohol, again a tad of licorice, and subtle chocolate. Medium to full body, slick/creamy texture, and average carbonation. Finish is medium long and very portery. Overall a really nice beer, a lot maltier and roastier than expected - kind of like a porter.

Bottled in Frape. Technically black color with huge floffy dark rust-brown head. Rich chocolate nose. Flavour is sweet with roasted and burned tones. Flavour is sweet, a bit spicy and well composed. Perfectly bodied beer, hiding the ABV very well. Palate could be more dominant - would be perfect then.

Roasted malts, wort, some coffee, some chocolat, nice spicy hops...
very sweet but with a good bitter counterbalance.. very thick very full... pretty good

Bottle bought at Delhaize.
Pours black with a big beige head.
Chocolate, roasted malts, very slightly bitterness, spices, raisin, slightly warm alcohol feeling in my throath but not overpowering. The sweetness in the aftertaste is little bit too much but, its a very good beer.
Bottle at home, dark brown/black beer with a medium head, aroma is malt and some chocolate. Taste is some malts, liquorice, fruit. Very nice.

Bouteille 33cl, BB 29/09/2016.
Brune foncée, col épais crémeux café au lait.
Arôme est léger et malté, au bouquet très belge. Le tout sur un fruité modéré de quad avec des relents de fruits noirs. Petite note épicée rappelant lanisé le tout sur une légère rondeur de sucre candi.
Palais est malté, grains, grillé avec un profil restant également assez belge sur lorientation de la levure. Note un agréable côté épicé de levure mais également de réglisse. Le tout est légèrement collant aux lèvres avec un rappel de sucre candi et malt crystal. Un léger fruité noir semble également présent mais moindre que sur dautres versions quad belges. Le profil des houblons perce en toute fin de bouche apportant une amertume qui reste cependant discrète. Solide sans vraiment changer le paysage des quads belges.

Nagenoeg zwart bier met grote beige schuimkraag.
Aromas van geroosterde mout met hint van chocolade. 
Smaak is bitter moutig met lichte kruidentoets.
Bitterige afdronk.
Deden mee aan de Brouwlandwedstrijd 2014
Reminds me the struise cuvée delphine for the aroma, but has the taste of Stout genre. Aftertaste is a bit "earthy".
Pours really dark brown. Feels like a stout slash alcohol. A bit watery. One would be much already.
Stout avec une belle mousse brunâtre. Bien crémeuse. Arrière goût pas trop prononcé. Un bon stout classique qui nest pas trop lourd.

Degustation glass @ Zytho, Kontich.
Poured dark brown with a tan lasting head. The head left marks on the glass.
Aroma had roasted malts, dark fruit, mocha.
Taste had chocolat in the end, roasted malts, mocha, a bit boozy, licorice.
Full mouthfeel.

Bottle: Served in a Chouffe glass:
Very big beige light brown head. Black beer, yep serious...
Aromas of toast, dried leaves, some malts, hint of chocolate, hint of manure and some hay.
Flavours of bitters, raisin, malts, whiskey malts, light spice, some chocolate/cacoa tones, yeast and dried leaves.
Aftertaste is a mix of bitters, toast, dried leaves, malts and some herbal toast...
Low carbo, more watery than creamy mouthfeel, more than medium bodied.
Decent beer.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text:
(Inglorious Quad) Bottle 330 ml, thanks to ElManana! Served into a small trappist glass, ABV 10.3%
Black colour on the body, quite tall and thick dark brown head, with very good retention, leaving medium lacing around the glass.
Aroma has coffee, dark fruits, light metallic notes but not annoying ones.
Taste of coffee, caramel, alcohol, coal, wood, prunes, dates, very good!
Medium thick body with notable carbonation. Slightly sticky palate.
Great quad this one!

330 ml bottle @ Gastropub Tuulensuu, Tampere. Pours a dark brown colour with a beige head. Aroma of rich raisin notes, wood, some biscuit and some berries. Rich flavour of toasted malts, raisin, orange marmalade, caramel, some elegant wooden tartness, licorice and roastiness. Quite strong bitterness. Full bodied and very smooth mouthfeel. Soft carbonation. Finishes sweet, dry and warming. Brilliant balance. One of the best beers this year.

330 ml bottle. At the Tuulensuu, Tampere, Finland. 
Dark reddish brown almost black colour with a small mid-brown head.
Roasted malt, chocolate, hops, vegetables, sweetness, ashy dryness and mild medicine notes in the aroma. Yummy!
Roasted malt, ashy dryness, alcohol, vegetables, hops, bitterness, cough drops, medicine and mild coffee in the flavour. Tasty. Smooth and rich. An excellent brew.

33 cl bottle @ Gastropub Tuulensuu. Aroma has spices, roasty malty tones and raisins. Also licorice tones. Flavour has strong licorice root tones , some candy sugar and spices. Also herbal tones and hints of ash. Quite stout-like for a quad - and lacks the sweetness typical to the style.

Sampled @ O.B.E.R. Kerstbierfestival 2014, Essen.

Sehr dunkelbraunes, fast schwarzes Bier mit geringer beiger Schaumkrone. Geruch sehr malzig, reifes Obst, Karamell, alkoholisch. Geschmack röstmalzig, süß, reifes Obst, leicht alkoholisch.

Sampled at Kerstbierfestival Essen 2014. Opaque pitch black color, medium sized brown head. Aroma is malts, liquorice, roast, some bitter, some sweetness. Tastes about the same: malts, roast, plenty of liquorice, slightly sweet and nicely bitter. Lightly creamy texture, medium to full body and carbonation. Nice one.
Poured deep dark brown with a lasting beige head. Aroma of roast malt, dark fruit and dark chocolate. Full body, flavour as the aroma, smooth caramel as well.

330ml bottle, thanks to Jefverstraete! Pours a thick silky black with big tan head. Aroma is soft sweet berries. Taste is liquorice heavy with dark toffee emerging as it warms. Enjoyable, evolving and delicious quad.

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2014   Bottle from Dranken Geers, Oostakker, nr Gent, consumed at home, Merton, Sunday 14th December 2014.   Pours dark brown with a tan head, looks great. Silky smooth indulgent and rich quad. Spicy but restrained. Top drawer quad for what I believe is a new kid on the block, bit sweet with dark mollasses showing, but very drinkable for strength.  A7 A4 T8 P4 Ov14 3.8
Bottle 33cl @ Tuulensuu. Pours dark ruby red with a beige head. Licorice, bread, dark malty, coffee aroma. Smooth, malty chocolate, coffee, caramel flavor. Very nice.

Dark and thick with a brownish head. 
Aroma: caramel, dark fruits, dark chocolate, roast. 
Taste: roasted malts, chocolate, coffe grids, creamy mouthfeel.

33 cl bottle @ Gastropub Tuulensuu.
Pours dark brown-red color with a medium sized head. Very malty and bready on the nose, lots of caramel and molasses too, some licorice comes through also. Quite sweet caramel flavor with lots and lots of licorice on the side, dry bready malts, faint wood and some subtle warming alcohol on the finish. 
Soft carbonation, mildly sourish palate with a sweet sugary finish. Very interesting flavors and nuances on this complex Quad, dont meet these too often. One of the most interesting brews Ive tasted this year. Excellent.
5336

4/XI/14 - 33cl bottle from Delhaize (Ledeberg) @ home - BB: 29/IX/16 (2014-1287) Thanks to my wife for the bottle!
Clear dark brown to black beer, big creamy beige big head, pretty stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: banana, sweet, caramel, dried fruits, mocha, alcohol, cocoa powder, bready. MF: ok carbon, medium body. taste: little sour, lots of chocolate, mocha, bit of coffee, alcohol, sugary touch, some vanilla. Aftertaste: mocha, little hoppy, roasted, some banana, little chemical, lots of alcohol, hoppy bitter finish.
caramel, caramel, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, very bitter, long finish, full body,

330 ml. bottle from Delhaize. Very dark blackish brown, coffee / mousse small but solid head. Nice lacing. Nose is umami chocolate truffle, bitter roasted coffee & herbal roast flourish. Light bitter roast coffee taste, liquorish, rich almost espresso coffee, herbal, chocolate mouse, lots of soy chocolate pudding, interesting creamy herbal bitterness, leaves. Coffee / pudding body but not overly thick or anything. Very lovely brew. The existence of Brouwerij Anders has given birth to some really lovely contract breweries in recent times.

Bottle 0.33l from De Hopduvel beer shop Ghent Belgium.Pour it dark color with thick black head.On the nose dark fruits.Taste and aroma of dried dark fruits, herbs, chocolate, little bit coffee.Tarty sweet end.Complexed.Perfect.

Bière noire de 10,3 % abv, classée en quad par le brasseur et ratebeer, mais qui se révèle être un imperial stout Prix au concours Brouwland 2014 de la meilleure bière amateur des plats pays
Tout un programme !
Couleur noir dencre, mais avec quelques reflets marron foncé.
Opacité quasi intégrale. Mousse beige foncé à café expresso, bien épaisse et crémeuse. De toute beauté.
Arômes de chocolat noir, café fin, noisette, pointe darmagnac et myrtille.
1ère bouche soyeuse et douce, à la prise forte sur du malt torréfié, café intense, tourbe, essence de pin.
Arrière-bouche bien maltée, très torréfiée, avec une fumée de cigare distinguée.
2ème avec des notes de bois de fût, et du genièvre fin, sur du malt torréfié.
Arrière-bouche longue, et nettement mieux intégrée.
3ème nez superbe, plein de finesse et détails.
3ème bouche beaucoup plus équilibrée, avec des fruits noirs, bois de santal, amandes, fèves sèches,
quelques herbes.
La longueur se développe sur des bois exotiques, avec du café expresso en retour, des fruits noirs,
fruits des bois, du sous-bois.
Les jambes sont grasses, longues, étirées.
La levure est très belle, épicée, un rien fleurie.
Lalcool est curieusement très supportable pour son niveau abv, mais il fait un bon travail sur les 
saveurs.
La finale donne du cake de Noël, des épices, une pointe de girofle, du câpre, de léglantine, et elle
est bien sûr beaucoup plus douce que lentame.
CONCLUSION : une bière qui est en fait un imperial stout, comme nous lavons dit. Les nez sont 
superbes, et léquilibre final témoigne dun grand travail sur les saveurs. Je voulais redéguster cette bière avant de la coter, et comme je le pressentais, ma seconde cote est plus haute que la première. Elle mérite amplement son prix de meilleure bière amateur  et dailleurs certains professionnels feraient bien den prendre de la graine !!! En bon amateur, salut ...

Noire, effervescence faible, sédiments en suspension, col brun crémeux moyen. Malts légèrement torréfiés, fruits noirs bien mûrs, sucre candi léger, un peu de moka, petite amertume, épicée mais pas trop, chaleur dalcool, plutôt ronde en bouche.

UPDATED: NOV 15, 2014 The winner of a brewing contest for hobby brewers issued by Brouwland, Belgiums best known shop for brewing materials. As a reward for their victory, the Delhaize supermarket chain has incorporated it in their range this autumn, and that is where I found the bottle. Moussy, deep beige, thin but dense head with good retention, colour a very, very dark wine red, as good as black, hazy. Very malty aroma, bitter chocolate, cold black coffee, Irish coffee, concentrated beef broth, charcoal, smoked bacon, toffee, vanilla, wood (even though this is not barrel aged), dried plums, elderberry, liquorice, brown rhum, almond, coriander seed, lavender, dried leaves, dried rosemary. Dense and rich taste, sweetish at first with candied fruits, dried banana, caramel, fatty and syrupy mouthfeel, smooth and somewhat powdery, medium carbonation, sourish and lightly soapy wheaty touch, very much caramelly, nutty and chocolatey malty with smoky accent, finishing with leafy hoppy notes, coffee-like mouth-filling bitterness and rhum- and whisky-like warming, but in all well-hidden alcohol; the chocolatey maltiness (and even some cloying sweetness) and the wheaty sourishness remain the longest. Complex, intense and deep beer, very interesting and well-made for a hobby brew. In terms of style, I do have a problem with it: this is not an abt and even less a quadrupel, this is a downright imperial stout (though admittedly one could argue it does lack some body for this style). But who cares: its a nicely perfumed sipper, perfectly fit for an autumn evening. Curious to see what this beer company, if they already deserve that status, will come up with in the future. For now, Id call this everything but inglorious, but I do get the irony, of course.

Bottle. Black with dark beige head. Aroma hops and roasted coffee, powerful. Taste very complex, going from sweet chocolatey, to roasted coffee, to bitter hoppy. Overall impression somewhere between imperial stout and porter, rater than quadruple. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

dense beige head leaves structured lacing. brown colour. aroma of coffee, thyme, quad esters, dried fruits, bit boozy. taste like aroma, some liquorice nice bitter sweet balance. quite creamy mouthfeel. medium body. abv well hidden. nice quad! bottle 33cl / bbf sep-2016

Dark brown nearly black. A small dissapeared head. Nose is chocolate, roasty, coffee. Body is meduium but with some watery tones paradoxically, carbon is sharp. Taste is bitter. palate is overhelmed by chocolate, cocoa, coffee and liqorica tones. Huge rust-coloured head, slightly irregular, over virtually black beer. Rich chocolate and bill/blackberry nose, bit of old sportshoes (sorry), roasted to burnt. Again a sweetish flavour with bitter/burnt edges, that is both billberry(pie) and mocha. First impression is sweet, dessert-like, finish is the coffee after the dessert (*). Quite well-bodied, hides its ABV surprisingly well. Only thing might be that the flavours fade a bit too quick for such a strong contender, but well... This aint half bad! Too bad they dont run a real brewery in Deurne.... Duke, Dobbel Gersten, if you please? (*)  If they would lager this on spirit oak barrel, we might get the pousse-café as well!
Bottle from De Hopduvel. Dark brown/black colour, creamy brown foam. Medium carbonation. Aroma of roasted malts, coffee, dark fruit and some caramel. Hoppy aftertaste. Well balanced. Good brew!
Liquid is black as night with a large brown head. Light aroma of coffee. Heavy body, no carbonation. Strong taste of coffee, quite bitter.
33cl, new exclusive brewfirm Anno 2014, from De Hopduvel Gent, complex brew, malty/spicy and slightly roasted/bitter, balanced, cloudy, good head, good brew

Bottle thnx to the brewer .
Pours dark brown to black . Big white head , rather stable . 
Smell is roasty , some coffee . 
Taste is bitter ( coffe , hops ) with a sweet , chocolate finish . The beer is in balance , yet different and with nice intensity . Perfect carbo . Mouthfeel could be a bit thicker at 10 abv , but is certainly not bad at all ! 

I like this beer !

Black brew in the glass. Very nice holding big head. A bit hard to smell.Good mixture of roasted malts, sweetness and bitterness, just misses a small boost. Very interested in more of this brewery. A very nice start.
